$MELI RESEARCH

BOTTOM LINE
MercadoLibre's marketplace-payments flywheel drives outsized growth but valuation remains elevated; revenue rose 37.53% YoY. Monitor monetization of Mercado Pago/Envios/Mercado Credito and margin conversion as catalysts to validate the premium.

COMPANY OVERVIEW
MercadoLibre runs online marketplaces and a fintech payments ecosystem across Latin America. Primary revenue drivers: Mercado Libre Marketplace, Mercado Pago, Mercado Envios and Mercado Credito. Market cap $103.16B; employees 84207. Sector: Consumer Cyclical Key Business: Operates Mercado Libre marketplace and Mercado Pago payments across Latin America

INVESTMENT THESIS
Core thesis: MercadoLibre's monetization of payments, logistics and lending is driving substantial year‚Äëover‚Äëyear growth and improving cash generation. Revenue increased 37.53% YoY and EPS increased 91.90% YoY; a $2,900 target is listed but coverage equals 0 analysts. Why now: accelerated monetization across payments, logistics and loans is translating to outsized top‚Äëline and profitability gains. Market perception shows strong fundamentals but no analyst validation of the listed target.

KEY METRICS
Price: $2034.82
Market Cap: $103.16B
Revenue: $7.41B (+37.5% YoY)
EPS: $40.88
Gross Margin: 45.14%,
Operating Margin: 11.96%,
Net Margin: 7.93%
P/E: 49.7, reflecting market valuation relative to current EPS and the company's 37.5% revenue growth on revenue of $7.41B and EPS of $40.88
ROE: 39.0%, showing high returns on equity alongside a P/B of 16.6 and ROA of 5.7%
EV/EBITDA: 33.3, implying a sizable enterprise multiple versus operating margin of 11.96% and net margin of 7.93% and underscores an elevated valuation profile

COMPETITIVE MOAT
Type: network effects, scale and fintech (MercadoPago, MercadoEnvios, MercadoCr√©dito) forming a marketplace-payments flywheel and switching costs. MELI trades at P/E 49.7x (148.3% premium) and P/S 3.9x (162.6% premium) vs sector median. Growth 0.4% (-7.6pp) and margin 0.5% (-34.5pp) conflict with companyMetrics revenueGrowth 37.5% and grossMargin 45.1%, implying the premiums use different measures. Durability: structural; valuation signals mixed.

RISK FACTORS
Leverage risk: Debt/Equity 1.59 creates exposure to LatAm currency and rate shocks despite Interest Coverage 19.8x. Liquidity risk: Current Ratio 1.17 and Quick Ratio 1.15 provide a limited short-term buffer for operations. Market risk: Beta 1.42 with 30- and 90-day volatility at 20.0% signals elevated share-price sensitivity.

VALUATION
DCF: intrinsic $1510.71 implies -26.91% vs current price $2034.82, driven by the source's DCF assumptions. Analyst targets $2700.00‚Äì$2900.00 imply +32.69% to +42.52% vs $2034.82 (median $2900.00 ‚Üí +42.52%), correcting the source's +0.0% figure. Historical P/E 10.0x‚Äì30.0x vs current P/E 49.7x notably shows a material premium, which conflicts with the DCF and underpins divergence between models and analysts.
